info.name: Yahoo! Cool Dark Purp + The Huffington Post
info.description:
A dark theme featuring classic Yahoo! purple to compliment cool shades of blue and grey.  This style works with most Yahoo! domains.  I tried to keep this simple and fast, so no replacement images or base64 are in this script.  

***UPDATE!***  I found this script also works with The Huffington Post.  It isn't seamless, but the layout is similar enough that I really like how this works.  If you prefer to keep your old install of Yahoo! Cool Dark Purp, just add [domain("huffingtonpost.com"),]  to the list below @-moz-document.
info.additionalInfo:
This is a modified version of boism's "Yahoo News - Dark Clean (also for eeepc)" to change some colors and add compatibility with more sites than just news (not all are perfect, but it totally works). [http://userstyles.org/styles/6890/yahoo-news-dark-clean-also-for-eeepc]  I think this also contains some elements of stormi's "Global dark style - changes everything to DARK," but I've been playing with this for a while and could be miscrediting and/or leaving out others. [http://userstyles.org/styles/31267/global-dark-style-changes-everything-to-dark]
 
Unless you want problems (or think you can fix them), don't use this with mail.yahoo.com or mail through the MyYahoo! page.  I tried using a similar script to this on Yahoo! Mail and the recipients received strangely-colored and unreadable text.
